examInfo.title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner Practice Exam

questions.question: Which of the following are advantages of cloud computing? (Select TWO)
options: A. Trade capital expense for variable expense
B. Maintain physical servers in your data center
C. Benefit from massive economies of scale
D. Increase time to market for new features
E. Reduce your focus on customers
questions.explanation: Cloud computing allows you to trade capital expense (buying servers) for variable expense (pay-as-you-go), and you benefit from AWS's massive economies of scale which result in lower pay-as-you-go prices. Cloud actually decreases time to market and allows you to focus more on customers.

questions.question: A company wants to deploy applications but does not want to manage the underlying infrastructure. Which cloud service model should they use?
questions.explanation: PaaS removes the need to manage underlying infrastructure (hardware, operating systems) and allows you to focus on deploying and managing applications. Examples include AWS Elastic Beanstalk and AWS Lambda.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on the ability to recover from failures and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?
questions.explanation: The Reliability pillar focuses on the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently, recover from failures, and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand.

questions.question: A company wants to move its on-premises application to AWS without making any changes to the application. Which migration strategy should they use?
questions.explanation: Rehosting (also known as 'lift and shift') involves moving applications to AWS without making changes. This is the fastest migration approach.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud in terms of cost?
options: B. Elimination of all operational expenditure
C. Trade capital expense for variable expense
D. Increased need for capacity planning
questions.explanation: Moving to AWS allows you to trade capital expense (CapEx) for variable expense (OpEx). Instead of investing heavily in data centers and servers before knowing how you're going to use them, you pay only when you consume computing resources.

questions.question: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is a customer responsibility?
options: A. Physical security of data centers
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for security IN the cloud, which includes configuring security groups, managing IAM users, and securing their data. AWS is responsible for security OF the cloud (physical security, hardware, network infrastructure).

questions.question: Which of the following is AWS responsible for under the Shared Responsibility Model?
options: B. Operating system patches on EC2 instances
C. Physical security of data centers
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for security OF the cloud, which includes physical security of data centers, hardware, and the global infrastructure. Customers are responsible for security IN the cloud, including OS patches, data encryption, and IAM management.

questions.question: Which IAM best practices should be followed? (Select TWO)
options: A. Use the root account for daily administrative tasks
B. Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) on the root account
C. Share access keys between users for convenience
E. Disable MFA for better usability
questions.explanation: Best practices include enabling MFA on the root account, granting least privilege (minimum permissions needed), creating individual IAM users instead of using root, and never sharing access keys.

questions.question: What is the purpose of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)?
options: B. Manage user access to AWS resources
questions.explanation: IAM enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. You can create and manage AWS users and groups, and use permissions to allow and deny their access to AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides DDoS protection at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield Standard is automatically enabled for all AWS customers at no additional cost and provides protection against common DDoS attacks. Shield Advanced requires a subscription fee.

questions.question: A company needs to identify and protect sensitive data stored in Amazon S3. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie is a data security service that uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII) in S3.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides on-demand access to AWS security and compliance reports?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a self-service portal for on-demand access to AWS compliance reports such as SOC, PCI, and ISO certifications. It's available at no cost.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you create and manage cryptographic keys?
questions.explanation: AWS KMS makes it easy to create and manage cryptographic keys and control their use across AWS services and in your applications. It integrates with most AWS services for encryption.

questions.question: Which service allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations helps you centrally manage and govern multiple AWS accounts. It provides consolidated billing, account grouping with organizational units (OUs), and policy-based management with Service Control Policies (SCPs).

questions.question: Which AWS service uses machine learning to detect threats and unauthorized activity in your AWS environment?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior using machine learning, anomaly detection, and integrated threat intelligence.

questions.question: What is an AWS Availability Zone?
options: A. A geographic location with multiple data centers
B. One or more discrete data centers with redundant power and networking
C. A content delivery network endpoint
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. Each Region has multiple isolated AZs.

questions.question: Which factors should you consider when choosing an AWS Region? (Select TWO)
options: A. Proximity to customers for lower latency
B. Number of Availability Zones (must be exactly 3)
C. Compliance with data residency requirements
D. Availability of all AWS services
E. Time zone of the Region
questions.explanation: When selecting a Region, consider: proximity to users (latency), compliance/data residency requirements, available services in that Region, and pricing (varies by Region). Not all services are available in all Regions.

questions.question: What is Amazon EC2?
options: C. Virtual servers in the cloud
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides resizable virtual servers (instances) in the cloud. It allows you to quickly scale compute capacity up or down as needed.

questions.question: Which EC2 pricing model provides up to 90% discount but instances can be terminated by AWS with a 2-minute warning?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity at up to 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices. However, AWS can reclaim the capacity with a 2-minute warning when needed.

questions.question: A company needs to run EC2 instances for 3 years continuously with predictable usage. Which pricing option would be MOST cost-effective?
questions.explanation: For steady-state, predictable workloads running continuously, Reserved Instances provide up to 75% discount compared to On-Demand. A 3-year commitment provides the highest discount.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to run code without provisioning or managing servers?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events and automatically manages the compute resources. You only pay for the compute time consumed.

questions.question: What is Amazon S3 primarily used for?
options: A. Block storage for EC2 instances
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an object storage service designed to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere. It's ideal for backup, archiving, analytics, and hosting static websites.

questions.question: Which S3 storage class is designed for data that is accessed less frequently but requires rapid access when needed?
questions.explanation: S3 Standard-IA (Infrequent Access) is designed for data that is accessed less frequently but requires rapid access when needed. It offers lower storage cost than S3 Standard with a retrieval fee.

questions.question: What is the durability of Amazon S3 Standard storage class?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 provides 99.999999999% (11 nines) durability by automatically storing data redundantly across multiple devices in multiple facilities within a Region.

questions.question: What type of storage does Amazon EBS provide?
options: B. Block storage for use with EC2
C. File storage for multiple instances
questions.explanation: Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) provides block-level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances. EBS volumes are attached to a single EC2 instance and persist independently from the instance lifecycle.

questions.question: Which storage service allows multiple EC2 instances to access the same file system simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) is a managed NFS file system that can be mounted on multiple EC2 instances simultaneously, allowing shared access to files.

questions.question: Which database engines are supported by Amazon RDS? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS supports six database engines: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, and Amazon Aurora. MongoDB and Cassandra are NoSQL databases not supported by RDS.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Multi-AZ deployments in Amazon RDS?
options: B. Provide high availability and automatic failover
questions.explanation: Multi-AZ deployments provide enhanced availability and durability by automatically replicating data to a standby instance in a different Availability Zone and providing automatic failover in case of an outage.

questions.question: What type of database is Amazon DynamoDB?
options: B. NoSQL key-value and document database
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. It supports both key-value and document data models.

questions.question: What is the difference between a security group and a network ACL?
options: A. Security groups are stateless; NACLs are stateful
B. Security groups are stateful; NACLs are stateless
C. Security groups operate at the subnet level; NACLs at the instance level
questions.explanation: Security groups are stateful (return traffic is automatically allowed) and operate at the instance level. Network ACLs are stateless (return traffic must be explicitly allowed) and operate at the subnet level.

questions.question: What is Amazon CloudFront?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency and high transfer speeds.

questions.question: What type of service is Amazon Route 53?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It also provides domain registration and health checking of resources.

questions.question: Which type of load balancer operates at Layer 7 (application layer) and supports advanced routing?
questions.explanation: Application Load Balancer operates at Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS) and provides advanced routing features like host-based and path-based routing, making it ideal for web applications.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Amazon CloudWatch?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and observability service that collects and tracks metrics, collects and monitors log files, sets alarms, and automatically reacts to changes in your AWS resources.

questions.question: What does AWS CloudTrail record?
options: B. API calls made in your AWS account
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls made in your AWS account, providing event history for governance, compliance, and auditing. It tracks who did what, when, and from where.

questions.question: What is AWS CloudFormation used for?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation is an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) service that allows you to model and provision AWS resources using templates (JSON or YAML), enabling automated and repeatable deployments.

questions.question: Which categories does AWS Trusted Advisor provide recommendations for? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations in five categories: Cost Optimization, Performance, Security, Fault Tolerance, and Service Limits. It helps optimize your AWS environment.

questions.question: Which AWS Snow Family device can store up to 100 PB of data?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowmobile is an exabyte-scale data transfer service that can move up to 100 PB of data in a 45-foot shipping container. Snowcone stores 8 TB, and Snowball Edge stores up to 80 TB.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to query data in S3 using standard SQL?
questions.explanation: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. It's serverless and you pay only for the queries you run.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed message queuing service?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.

questions.question: Which pricing model allows you to pay only for the compute time you consume?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances let you pay for compute capacity by the hour or second with no long-term commitments. You pay only for the compute time you consume.

questions.question: Which EC2 pricing option provides the HIGHEST discount?
questions.explanation: 3-year Reserved Instances provide the highest discount (up to 75%) compared to On-Demand pricing. The longer the commitment and the more upfront you pay, the greater the discount.

questions.question: Which AWS tool helps you visualize and analyze your AWS costs and usage over time?
options: D. AWS Cost and Usage Report
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer provides visualizations of your AWS costs and usage over time, allows you to filter and group data, and can forecast future costs based on historical data.

questions.question: Which service allows you to set custom cost and usage budgets and receive alerts?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows you to set custom cost and usage budgets and receive alerts via email or SNS when your usage or costs exceed (or are forecasted to exceed) your budgeted amount.

questions.question: What is the AWS Free Tier?
options: A. A permanent free tier for all AWS services
B. Free access to select AWS services for 12 months plus always-free offers
C. A discount program for startups only
questions.explanation: The AWS Free Tier provides limited free usage of select AWS services for 12 months after account creation, plus always-free offers for certain services, and short-term free trials for others.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides a Technical Account Manager (TAM)?
questions.explanation: Only the Enterprise Support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager (TAM) who provides consultative architectural and operational guidance.

questions.question: What is the response time for a business-critical system down issue with Enterprise Support?
questions.explanation: Enterprise Support provides a 15-minute response time for business-critical system down issues. Business Support provides 1 hour for production system down issues.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan is available to all AWS customers at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: The Basic Support plan is included free for all AWS customers and provides 24/7 access to customer service, documentation, whitepapers, and support forums.

questions.question: What are benefits of using AWS Organizations with consolidated billing? (Select TWO)
options: A. One bill for all accounts
C. Volume pricing discounts across accounts
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing provides one bill for multiple accounts and allows you to combine usage across accounts to receive volume pricing discounts. It doesn't provide automatic optimization or free support.

questions.question: For most AWS services, which type of data transfer is typically FREE?
options: A. Data transfer out to the Internet
B. Data transfer in from the Internet
D. Data transfer to CloudFront from other AWS services
questions.explanation: Data transfer IN to AWS from the Internet is typically free for most services. Data transfer OUT to the Internet is charged based on the amount of data transferred.

questions.question: What is the recommended way to grant permissions to an EC2 instance to access S3?
options: A. Store access keys on the EC2 instance
B. Attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance
C. Use the root account credentials
D. Create an IAM user and share the password
questions.explanation: The best practice is to attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance. This provides temporary credentials that are automatically rotated, eliminating the need to store long-term credentials on the instance.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides serverless container orchestration?
options: A. Amazon ECS with EC2 launch type
questions.explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with both Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS. It removes the need to provision and manage servers.

questions.question: Which AWS service extends AWS infrastructure and services to your on-premises data center?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts brings native AWS services, infrastructure, and operating models to virtually any data center, co-location space, or on-premises facility, enabling a truly consistent hybrid experience.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected Framework pillar focuses on minimizing environmental impact?
questions.explanation: The Sustainability pillar, added in 2021, focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of running cloud workloads, including energy consumption and resource efficiency.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you build, train, and deploy machine learning models?
questions.explanation: Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides developers and data scientists the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly.

questions.question: What is Amazon Redshift primarily used for?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fast, fully managed data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze large amounts of data using SQL and business intelligence tools.

questions.question: Which AWS service protects web applications from common web exploits like SQL injection and cross-site scripting?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) helps protect web applications from common web exploits and bots that could affect availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.

questions.question: Which S3 storage class offers the lowest storage cost and is designed for long-term archive with retrieval times of 12-48 hours?
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest-cost storage class, designed for data that is rarely accessed and requires retrieval times of 12-48 hours. It's ideal for compliance archives.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling?
options: A. Reduce costs by terminating all instances during low demand
B. Automatically adjust compute capacity to maintain performance and optimize costs
D. Improve security by rotating instances regularly
questions.explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling helps maintain application availability and allows you to automatically add or remove EC2 instances according to conditions you define, optimizing both performance and costs.

questions.question: Which deployment model connects cloud resources to on-premises infrastructure?
questions.explanation: A hybrid deployment connects cloud-based resources to on-premises infrastructure, allowing you to extend and grow your infrastructure while connecting cloud resources to internal systems.

questions.question: Which strategies can help optimize costs in AWS? (Select TWO)
options: A. Right-sizing instances based on utilization
B. Running all workloads on the largest instance types
C. Using Reserved Instances for steady-state workloads
E. Storing all data in S3 Standard regardless of access patterns
questions.explanation: Cost optimization strategies include right-sizing instances to match workload requirements, using Reserved Instances or Savings Plans for predictable workloads, and choosing appropriate storage classes based on access patterns.

questions.question: Which AWS service implements a publish/subscribe (pub/sub) messaging pattern?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service) is a pub/sub messaging service that enables you to send messages to multiple subscribers, including email, SMS, mobile push, and HTTP endpoints.

questions.question: Which service continuously monitors and records AWS resource configurations for compliance auditing?
questions.explanation: AWS Config continuously monitors and records your AWS resource configurations, allowing you to audit and evaluate configurations against desired settings for compliance and troubleshooting.

questions.question: What level of control does AWS Elastic Beanstalk provide over infrastructure?
options: B. Full control over all underlying resources
C. Control over application deployment with automatic infrastructure management
D. Control only over database configuration
questions.explanation: Elastic Beanstalk automatically handles capacity provisioning, load balancing, and auto-scaling, but you retain full control over the underlying resources and can access them directly if needed.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the AWS Pricing Calculator?
options: A. To view your current AWS bill
B. To estimate the cost of AWS services for your use case
C. To automatically optimize your AWS costs
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator allows you to explore AWS services and create cost estimates for your use cases without needing an AWS account. It helps in planning and budgeting.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using AWS Direct Connect over a VPN connection?
options: C. More consistent network performance and higher bandwidth
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private connection from your data center to AWS, offering more consistent network performance, reduced bandwidth costs, and higher throughput compared to Internet-based connections.

questions.question: Which compliance program is specifically for payment card industry requirements?
questions.explanation: PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that companies that accept, process, store, or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment.

questions.question: What are the database engines compatible with Amazon Aurora?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL, offering up to 5x the performance of MySQL and 3x the performance of PostgreSQL at a fraction of the cost of commercial databases.

questions.question: What does elasticity mean in cloud computing?
options: A. The ability to manually add resources when needed
B. The ability to automatically scale resources up or down based on demand
C. The ability to move workloads between regions
D. The ability to restore from backups
questions.explanation: Elasticity is the ability to automatically acquire and release resources as needed to match demand, ensuring you have the right amount of resources at any given time without over or under-provisioning.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides image and video analysis capabilities?
questions.explanation: Amazon Rekognition is a service that makes it easy to add image and video analysis to applications using proven, highly scalable, deep learning technology.

questions.question: What does MFA stand for in AWS security?
questions.explanation: MFA stands for Multi-Factor Authentication, which adds an extra layer of protection by requiring both a password and a second factor (like a code from an authenticator app) to sign in.

questions.question: What can S3 Lifecycle policies be used for?
options: A. Automatically delete or transition objects between storage classes
C. Automatically replicate objects to other buckets
questions.explanation: S3 Lifecycle policies allow you to automatically transition objects between storage classes or expire (delete) objects based on age, helping optimize storage costs.

questions.question: What is the maximum execution time for an AWS Lambda function?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda functions have a maximum execution timeout of 15 minutes. For longer-running tasks, consider using ECS, EC2, or Step Functions.

questions.question: What is the response time for a production system down issue with Business Support?
questions.explanation: Business Support provides a 1-hour response time for production system down issues. Enterprise Support provides 15 minutes for business-critical system down.

questions.question: Which caching engines does Amazon ElastiCache support? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache supports two open-source in-memory caching engines: Redis and Memcached. Both provide sub-millisecond latency for caching use cases.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a Capital Expenditure (CapEx)?
options: A. Monthly AWS bill for services used
B. Purchasing physical servers for a data center
C. Paying for Lambda function executions
questions.explanation: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) refers to upfront purchases of physical infrastructure like servers and data centers. Cloud services like AWS represent Operational Expenditure (OpEx).

questions.question: What allows instances in a private subnet to access the internet for updates while remaining private?
questions.explanation: A NAT Gateway enables instances in private subnets to connect to the internet (for updates, patches) while preventing inbound connections from the internet.

questions.question: Which type of encryption protects data while it is being transmitted over a network?
questions.explanation: Encryption in transit protects data as it moves between locations (e.g., from your application to AWS services) using protocols like TLS/SSL. Encryption at rest protects stored data.

questions.question: What is the primary difference between Amazon SNS and Amazon SQS?
options: A. SNS is push-based; SQS is pull-based
B. SNS is pull-based; SQS is push-based
C. SNS stores messages; SQS doesn't
questions.explanation: SNS is a push notification service that sends messages to subscribers immediately. SQS is a message queue where consumers pull messages when ready. SNS is pub/sub; SQS is point-to-point.

questions.question: Which EC2 instance family is optimized for memory-intensive applications?
questions.explanation: R-family instances (like R5, R6) are memory-optimized and designed for memory-intensive applications like in-memory databases, big data analytics, and real-time processing.

questions.question: Which services are covered by AWS Compute Savings Plans?
questions.explanation: Compute Savings Plans provide flexibility across EC2, Lambda, and Fargate usage, regardless of instance family, size, OS, tenancy, or Region.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Amazon RDS Read Replicas?
options: A. Automatic failover for high availability
questions.explanation: Read Replicas are used to scale out read-heavy workloads by offloading read queries from the primary database. Multi-AZ is used for high availability and failover.

questions.question: By default, what traffic do security groups allow?
options: A. All inbound and outbound traffic
B. All outbound traffic; no inbound traffic
C. All inbound traffic; no outbound traffic
D. No traffic in either direction
questions.explanation: By default, security groups allow all outbound traffic and deny all inbound traffic. You must explicitly add inbound rules to allow traffic to your instances.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using CloudFront with S3?
options: B. Lower latency for global users
questions.explanation: CloudFront is a CDN that caches S3 content at edge locations worldwide, providing lower latency and faster delivery to users regardless of their geographic location.

questions.question: How does cloud computing increase agility for organizations?
options: A. By reducing the need for IT staff
B. By making resources available in minutes instead of weeks
C. By eliminating all security concerns
D. By reducing all operational costs to zero
questions.explanation: Cloud computing increases agility by allowing organizations to provision resources in minutes rather than weeks, enabling faster experimentation, innovation, and time to market.

questions.question: What is the purpose of S3 Transfer Acceleration?
options: B. Speed up long-distance file transfers to S3 using CloudFront edge locations
questions.explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration uses CloudFront's globally distributed edge locations to accelerate uploads to S3, improving transfer speeds for users far from the bucket's region.

questions.question: What are Service Control Policies (SCPs) used for in AWS Organizations?
options: A. Set billing budgets for accounts
B. Define maximum available permissions for accounts in an organization
questions.explanation: SCPs are a type of organization policy that you can use to manage permissions in your organization. They set the maximum available permissions and don't grant permissions themselves.

questions.question: Which AWS Systems Manager capability allows you to securely connect to EC2 instances without SSH keys or bastion hosts?
questions.explanation: Session Manager provides secure and auditable instance management without the need to open inbound ports, maintain bastion hosts, or manage SSH keys.

questions.question: What type of scaling does DynamoDB provide?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB automatically scales horizontally to handle increased traffic by distributing data across multiple partitions, providing seamless performance at any scale.

questions.question: What is the difference between Standard and Convertible Reserved Instances?
options: B. Convertible RIs allow you to change instance families; Standard RIs don't
C. Standard RIs have longer commitment terms
D. Convertible RIs don't provide any discount
questions.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances allow you to change instance families, operating systems, and tenancies, while Standard RIs offer higher discounts but less flexibility.

questions.question: What is AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) primarily used for?
options: B. Migrating databases to AWS with minimal downtime
D. Creating database replicas for testing
questions.explanation: AWS DMS helps you migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely. The source database remains fully operational during migration, minimizing downtime.

questions.question: What does Amazon Comprehend do?
options: C. Performs natural language processing to extract insights from text
questions.explanation: Amazon Comprehend uses natural language processing (NLP) to extract insights and relationships from text, including sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and topic modeling.

questions.question: What does Amazon Inspector assess?
options: B. Security vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector automatically assesses applications for security vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices, providing detailed findings prioritized by severity.

questions.question: Where are EBS snapshots stored?
questions.explanation: EBS snapshots are automatically stored in Amazon S3 with built-in redundancy across multiple Availability Zones within a region, though you don't directly access them through S3.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected pillar includes the principle 'Implement a strong identity foundation'?
questions.explanation: The Security pillar includes implementing a strong identity foundation as one of its key design principles, emphasizing the principle of least privilege and IAM best practices.

questions.question: What does AWS Cost Anomaly Detection use to identify unusual spending?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Anomaly Detection uses machine learning to automatically detect and alert you to unusual spending patterns, helping you identify cost overruns quickly.

questions.question: Which Kinesis service is used to load streaming data into AWS data stores?
questions.explanation: Kinesis Data Firehose is the easiest way to load streaming data into data stores and analytics tools like S3, Redshift, Elasticsearch, and Splunk with minimal configuration.

questions.question: What format(s) can AWS CloudFormation templates be written in?
questions.explanation: CloudFormation templates can be written in either JSON or YAML format, allowing you to define infrastructure as code using whichever format you prefer.

questions.question: What is AWS Secrets Manager used for?
options: B. Storing and rotating database credentials and API keys
questions.explanation: AWS Secrets Manager helps you protect access to applications, services, and IT resources by enabling you to easily rotate, manage, and retrieve database credentials, API keys, and other secrets.

questions.question: What is AWS Step Functions used for?
options: B. Orchestrating workflows and coordinating multiple AWS services
questions.explanation: AWS Step Functions is a serverless workflow orchestration service that lets you coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows using visual workflows called state machines.

questions.question: Which AWS best practice helps achieve high availability?
options: A. Deploy resources in a single Availability Zone
B. Deploy resources across multiple Availability Zones
C. Use only the largest instance types
D. Store all backups in the same region as production
questions.explanation: Deploying resources across multiple Availability Zones helps achieve high availability by protecting against failures in a single data center or AZ.

questions.question: Who is Amazon Lightsail designed for?
options: A. Enterprise customers running complex architectures
B. Users who need simple virtual private servers with predictable pricing
questions.explanation: Amazon Lightsail is designed for users who need simple virtual private servers with predictable monthly pricing, making it ideal for simple web applications, blogs, and small businesses.

questions.question: Which services have always-free tier offerings? (Select TWO)
options: B. Amazon EC2 (750 hours per month)
C. AWS Lambda (1 million requests per month)
D. Amazon RDS (750 hours per month)
questions.explanation: DynamoDB (25 GB storage, 25 provisioned capacity units) and Lambda (1 million requests per month) are always free. EC2, RDS, and S3 free tiers expire after 12 months.

questions.question: What is AWS Global Accelerator used for?
options: A. Caching content at edge locations
B. Improving availability and performance using AWS global network
D. Speeding up EC2 instance launches
questions.explanation: AWS Global Accelerator improves availability and performance of applications by routing traffic through AWS's global network infrastructure to optimal endpoints based on health, geography, and routing policies.

questions.question: When should you use AWS CloudHSM instead of AWS KMS?
options: A. When you need simple encryption key management
B. When you require dedicated hardware security modules for regulatory compliance
C. When you want the lowest cost option
D. When you need automatic key rotation
questions.explanation: CloudHSM provides dedicated hardware security modules in the AWS Cloud for customers who require dedicated hardware for regulatory compliance or additional control over key management.

questions.question: What is Amazon API Gateway commonly used with?
questions.explanation: Amazon API Gateway is commonly used with AWS Lambda to create serverless APIs, though it can also be used with EC2, ECS, and other AWS services.

questions.question: What is AWS X-Ray used for?
options: B. Analyzing and debugging distributed applications
questions.explanation: AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug distributed applications, providing insights into how applications and underlying services are performing to identify bottlenecks.

questions.question: What is the difference between high availability and fault tolerance?
options: B. High availability minimizes downtime; fault tolerance has zero downtime
C. Fault tolerance is cheaper to implement
D. High availability requires manual intervention
questions.explanation: High availability focuses on minimizing downtime with quick recovery. Fault tolerance is designed to continue operating without interruption even when components fail, typically at higher cost.

questions.question: What is Amazon WorkSpaces?
questions.explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed, secure Desktop-as-a-Service (DaaS) solution that allows users to access their cloud-based desktops from anywhere.

questions.question: What type of APIs does AWS AppSync create?
questions.explanation: AWS AppSync is a managed service that uses GraphQL to make it easy for applications to get exactly the data they need, enabling real-time data synchronization.

questions.question: How many Trusted Advisor checks are available with Basic and Developer support?
questions.explanation: Basic and Developer support plans have access to 7 core Trusted Advisor checks. Business and Enterprise plans have access to all checks.

questions.question: What type of workloads is AWS Batch designed for?
options: B. Batch computing jobs at any scale
questions.explanation: AWS Batch enables you to run batch computing workloads on AWS, dynamically provisioning the optimal quantity and type of compute resources based on volume and requirements.

questions.question: What does AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) provide?
options: B. Free SSL/TLS certificates for AWS services
questions.explanation: AWS Certificate Manager provides free public SSL/TLS certificates for use with AWS services like ELB, CloudFront, and API Gateway, with automatic renewal.

questions.question: What was Amazon EventBridge previously called?
questions.explanation: Amazon EventBridge is an evolution of CloudWatch Events, providing a serverless event bus service that makes it easy to connect applications using events.

questions.question: What is the difference between vertical and horizontal scaling?
options: A. Vertical adds more instances; horizontal increases instance size
B. Vertical increases instance size; horizontal adds more instances
C. They are the same thing
D. Vertical is for databases; horizontal is for compute
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling (scale up) means increasing the size/power of individual resources. Horizontal scaling (scale out) means adding more instances. Cloud excels at horizontal scaling.

questions.question: What is AWS Glue primarily used for?
questions.explanation: AWS Glue is a fully managed ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) service that makes it easy to prepare and transform data for analytics, with a serverless architecture.

questions.question: What is Amazon QuickSight?
options: B. A business intelligence and data visualization service
questions.explanation: Amazon QuickSight is a fast, cloud-powered business intelligence service that makes it easy to create and publish interactive dashboards with ML-powered insights.

questions.question: Where is the AWS Cost and Usage Report delivered?
options: C. Through the AWS Console only
questions.explanation: The AWS Cost and Usage Report is delivered to an S3 bucket you specify, providing the most comprehensive cost and usage data available in CSV or Parquet format.

questions.question: What is AWS Control Tower used for?
options: B. Setting up and governing a secure multi-account AWS environment
questions.explanation: AWS Control Tower provides an easy way to set up and govern a secure, multi-account AWS environment based on best practices, using pre-configured guardrails and account blueprints.

questions.question: What does Amazon Detective help with?
options: B. Investigating potential security issues and finding root causes
questions.explanation: Amazon Detective makes it easy to analyze, investigate, and quickly identify the root cause of potential security issues or suspicious activities using machine learning and graph theory.
